title: What is RCM concept in GST? - Quora
tags: Goods and Services Tax in India

response.answer_text: RCM Means Reverse Charge Machanism in which recipient of service is liable to pay GST. For Example in Goods Transport Agency case when one businessmen availing the service of goods transport agency for transporting their goods then the businessmen will be liable to pay gst on the invoice value of goods transport agency. The Goods transport agency will not charge any GST in their invoice. Advocate Service, Security Service are also the examples of Reverse Charge Machanism in GST in which recipient of service will be liable to pay GST.

RCM stands Reverse Charge Mechanism which is not a new concept as it was already running in Service Tax Regime too but currently, it is also applicable in the GST regime but with narrow concept comparatively to its earlier version. Now How it works- Simply it is a reverse process of the normal tax system as in RCM GST is being paid by the entity which takes the Service, not the provider as in the normal case. Like in case of Advocate, Transport Agency, Insurance Agent etc  Picture - From ClearTax
